text: Acleris santacrucis is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from California. The wingspan is about 14 mm. The forewings are ochreous with a silky gloss and brownish-ochreous reticulation. The hindwings are silky white, slightly yellowish at the apex.Obraztsov, 1963. Some North American moths of the genus Acleris (Lepidoptera: Tortricidae). Proceedings of the United States National Museum. 114: 214 Adults have been recorded on wing from June to August and in October.mothphotographersgroup ==References== Category:Moths described in 1963 santacrucis Category:Moths of North America
title: Acleris santacrucis
